headline: Is PayPal (PYPL) Undervalued After Recent Share Price Weakness? A Fresh Look at Its Valuation
summary: PayPal Holdings (PYPL) has quietly slipped again, with the stock down about 7% over the past month and more than 10% in the past 3 months, despite steady revenue and profit growth. See our latest analysis for PayPal Holdings. Zooming out, the 1 year total shareholder return of about negative 31 percent and a year to date share price return near negative 29 percent signal that sentiment has been fading even as PayPal keeps posting reasonable top line and bottom line growth. If PayPal easing...

headline: JPMorgan Downgrades PayPal Stock On Views Turnaround Drags Under New CEO
summary: PayPal dipped after JPMorgan downgraded the stock to neutral from overweight on views its turnaround is taking longer than expected.

content.title: JPMorgan Downgrades PayPal Stock On Views Turnaround Drags Under New CEO
content.summary: PayPal dipped after JPMorgan downgraded the stock to neutral from overweight on views its turnaround is taking longer than expected.

headline: One Inc Partners with Benekiva to Deliver Fully Digital Claims Payment Experience
summary: FOLSOM, Calif., December 04, 2025--One Inc, the leading digital payments network for the insurance industry, today announced a partnership with Benekiva, a leading insurtech dedicated to transforming claims management with speed, intelligence, and compassion. Together, the companies will deliver a fully digital claims payment experience for Benekiva’s carrier-policyholders, from first notice of loss through final payout.

content.title: One Inc Partners with Benekiva to Deliver Fully Digital Claims Payment Experience
content.summary: FOLSOM, Calif., December 04, 2025--One Inc, the leading digital payments network for the insurance industry, today announced a partnership with Benekiva, a leading insurtech dedicated to transforming claims management with speed, intelligence, and compassion. Together, the companies will deliver a fully digital claims payment experience for Benekiva’s carrier-policyholders, from first notice of loss through final payout.

headline: Markets View Weak Job Data as Good News. Why That’s a Problem.

headline: Here Are Thursday’s Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: AutoZone, BXP, Fiserv, Meta Platforms, PayPal, Salesforce, Toast and More
summary: Pre-Market Stock Futures: The futures are trading modestly higher on Thursday after a rollercoaster session on Wednesday, as stocks fell after the open on weak ADP data showing private-sector employment shed 32,000 jobs in November, the largest in 2-1/2 years. That didn’t last long, as bonds rallied on hopes of a rate cut next week ... Here Are Thursday’s Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: AutoZone, BXP, Fiserv, Meta Platforms, PayPal, Salesforce, Toast and More

headline: Stocks Muted Before the Open as Rally Pauses, U.S. Jobless Claims Data on Tap
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.02%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.01% this morning, taking a breather after recent gains, while investors look ahead to U.S. jobless claims data, which will offer fresh insight into the labor market ahead of next week’s Federal Reserve meeting.

content.title: Stocks Muted Before the Open as Rally Pauses, U.S. Jobless Claims Data on Tap
content.summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.02%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.01% this morning, taking a breather after recent gains, while investors look ahead to U.S. jobless claims data, which will offer fresh insight into the labor market ahead of next week’s Federal Reserve meeting.

headline: JPMorgan sees 2026 clean slate for fintech, raises Toast and names Visa top pick
summary: Investing.com -- JPMorgan expects 2026 to mark a reset for payments and fintech stocks after what it calls the sector’s worst year in 15 years, excluding the COVID shock.

headline: Buy Visa and Toast, Ignore PayPal. How J.P. Morgan Is Playing Payments Stocks in 2026.
summary: With payments stocks on track for their worst non-pandemic year since the Great Recession, investors should fall back on names with strong fundamentals in 2026, J.P. Morgan says.  Visa  and  Toast  on the other hand, are solid bets, the firm argued.  J.P. Morgan downgraded  PayPal  a day after the company’s finance and operations chief warned of sluggish growth in its branded checkout business.

content.title: Buy Visa and Toast, Ignore PayPal. How J.P. Morgan Is Playing Payments Stocks in 2026.
